gurmukhi: isAwm Gtw GumrI GnGor kY Gyir lIE hir ko riv qYsy ]
transliteration: Siaam Ghataa Ghoumroo Ghanhor Kai Gher(i) Looo Har(i) Ko Rav(i) Taise||
translation: The army of demons appears like the sun-chariot of the Lord encircled by the dark thundering clouds.

gurmukhi: skR kmwn ky bwn lgy sr Pok lsY Air ky auir AYsy ]
transliteration: Sakra Kamaan Ke Baan Lage Sar Phok Lasai Ar(i) Ke Ur(i) Aise||
translation: The sharp edges of the arrows shot from the bow of Indra, poiercing the hearts of the enemies glisten.

gurmukhi: mwno phwr krwr mYN coNc pswr rhy issu swrk jYsy ]66]
transliteration: Maano Pahaar Karaar Main Chonch Pasaar Rahe Sis(u) Saarak Jaise||66||
translation: Like the beaks of the young once of strokes spread in the caves of the mountains.66.

gurmukhi: bwn lgy lK suMB deIq Dsy rn lY krvwrn ko ]
transliteration: Baan Lage Lakh Sounbh Daoot Dhase Ran Lai Karvaaran Ko||
translation: Seeing the king Sumbh pierced by the arrows, the demons-forces jumped into the battlefield, drawing out their swords.

gurmukhi: rMg BUm mY sqR igrwie dey bhu sRaun bihE Asurwrn ko ]
transliteration: Ran Bhoom Mai Satra Giraae Dae Bahu Sraoun Bahio Asuraaran Ko||
translation: They slayed many enemies in the field and in this way good deal of the blood of the gods flowed.

gurmukhi: pRgty gn jMbuk giR`J ipswc su XO rn BwNiq pukwrn ko ]
transliteration: Pragte Gad Janbouk Grijjh Pisaach Su Yau Ran Bhaant(i0 Poukaaran Ko||
translation: Various types of ganas, jackals, vultures, ghosts etc., appearing in the battlefield, produced various sounds in such a way;

gurmukhi: su mno Bt swrsuqI qt nHwq hY pUrb pwp auqwrn ko ]67]
transliteration: Su Mano Bhat Saarsuroo Tat Nbaat Hai Poorab Paap Outaaran Ko||67||
translation: As though the warriors, at the time of taking bath in Saraswati river are removing various types of their sins.67.

gurmukhi: ju`D insuMB BieAwn ricE As Awgy n dwnv kwhU kirE hY ]
transliteration: Juddh Nisounbh Bhaiaan Rachio As Aage Na Daanav Kaahoo Kario Hai||
translation: Nisumbh then waged such a terrible war, as none of the demons had waged earlier.

gurmukhi: loQn aUpir loQ prI qh gID siRMgwln mwsu cirE hY ]
transliteration: Lothan Oopar(i) Loth Daroo Tah Goodh Sringadlan Maas(u) Chariot Hai||
translation: The corpses are amassed on corpses and their flesh is being eaten by jackals and vultures.

gurmukhi: gUMd bhY isr kysn qy isq puMj pÍwh Drwn pirE hY ]
transliteration: Goond Bahai Sir Kesan Te Sit Pounj Pravaah Dharaan Pario Hai||
translation: The white current of fat coming out of the heads is falling on the ground in this way;

gurmukhi: mwnhu jtwDr kI jt qy jnu ros kY gMg ko nIr FirE hY ]68]
transliteration: Maanoh Jataadhar Koo Jat Te Jan(u) Ros Kai Gadg Ko Noor Dhario Hai||68||
translation: As if the current of Ganga hath gushed out of he hair of Shiva.68.

gurmukhi: bwr isvwr Bey iqh Taur su Pyn ijau CqR iPry qrqw ]
transliteration: Baar Sivaar Bhae Tih Thaur Soup Hen Jio Chhatra Phire Tartaa||
translation: The hair of the heads are floating on water like scum and the canopies of the kings like froth.

gurmukhi: kr AMgulkw sPrI qlPY Buj kwt BujMg kry krqw ]
transliteration: Kar Anulkaa Saphroo Talphai Bhuj Kaat Bhujan Dare Kartaa||
translation: The gingers of hands are writhing like fish and the chopped arms seem like serpents.
